results.title: Management of dyslipidemia and hyperglycemia with a fixed-dose combination of sitagliptin and simvastatin
results.text_hl: Based on the available evidence regarding the pharmacokinetics and the efficacy and safety profiles of each component drug, the @CHEMICAL_Sitagliptin_Phosphate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068900 @@@sitagliptin@@@/@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ FDC may provide a rational and well-tolerated approach to achieving better adherence to multiple-drug therapy and improved @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ lowering and glycemic control, with consequent reduction in cardiovascular risk, @<m>DISEASE_612623</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:612623 @@@diabetic microvascular disease@@@, and mortality in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ for whom treatment with both compounds is appropriate.

citations.NLM: Steinberg H, Anderson MS, Musliner T, Hanson ME, Engel SS. Management of dyslipidemia and hyperglycemia with a fixed-dose combination of sitagliptin and simvastatin Vasc Health Risk Manag. 2013;9():273-82. PMID: 23761972
